frontmatter.title: What are Student Loans?
frontmatter.excerpt: How do you pay for school when you exhaust financial aid, scholarships, and grants? Student loans cover unmet financial need to pay for tuition and/or living expenses. The lender is generally the government or bank and the student pays back the amount they borrowed plus interest.

frontmatter.title: What are Income Share Agreements?
frontmatter.excerpt: They are agreements between two parties - but instead of the borrower repaying the original amount (the principal) with interest, they repay with a portion of their income for a certain amount of time. In our case, the borrower is the student and the lender is the mentor.
